{"step_by_step_thinking": "Nephrotic syndrome is characterized by heavy proteinuria, hypoalbuminemia, and edema. FSGS (Focal Segmental Glomerulosclerosis), MPGN (Membranoproliferative Glomerulonephritis), and Minimal Change Disease are all types of glomerulonephritis that can present with nephrotic syndrome. However, Post-infectious Glomerulonephritis typically presents with nephritic syndrome, not nephrotic syndrome.", "answer_choice": "B"}
